verses.text: ‘Lord,’ he said, ‘if I have found favour in your eyes, then let the Lord go with us. Although this is a stiff-necked people, forgive our wickedness and our sin, and take us as your inheritance.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said: ‘I am making a covenant with you. Before all your people I will do wonders never before done in any nation in all the world. The people you live among will see how awesome is the work that I, the Lord, will do for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Obey what I command you today. I will drive out before you the Amorites, Canaanites, Hittites, Perizzites, Hivites and Jebusites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be careful not to make a treaty with those who live in the land where you are going, or they will be a snare among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Break down their altars, smash their sacred stones and cut down their Asherah poles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not worship any other god, for the Lord, whose name is Jealous, is a jealous God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Be careful not to make a treaty with those who live in the land; for when they prostitute themselves to their gods and sacrifice to them, they will invite you and you will eat their sacrifices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when you choose some of their daughters as wives for your sons and those daughters prostitute themselves to their gods, they will lead your sons to do the same.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Do not make any idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Celebrate the Festival of Unleavened Bread. For seven days eat bread made without yeast, as I commanded you. Do this at the appointed time in the month of Aviv, for in that month you came out of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘The first offspring of every womb belongs to me, including all the firstborn males of your livestock, whether from herd or flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Redeem the firstborn donkey with a lamb, but if you do not redeem it, break its neck. Redeem all your firstborn sons.
‘No one is to appear before me empty-handed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Six days you shall labour, but on the seventh day you shall rest; even during the ploughing season and harvest you must rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Celebrate the Festival of Weeks with the firstfruits of the wheat harvest, and the Festival of Ingathering at the turn of the year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Three times a year all your men are to appear before the Sovereign Lord, the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will drive out nations before you and enlarge your territory, and no one will covet your land when you go up three times each year to appear before the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Do not offer the blood of a sacrifice to me along with anything containing yeast, and do not let any of the sacrifice from the Passover Festival remain until morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Bring the best of the firstfruits of your soil to the house of the Lord your God.
‘Do not cook a young goat in its mother’s milk.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, ‘Write down these words, for in accordance with these words I have made a covenant with you and with Israel.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses was there with the Lord forty days and forty nights without eating bread or drinking water. And he wrote on the tablets the words of the covenant – the Ten Commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses came down from Mount Sinai with the two tablets of the covenant law in his hands, he was not aware that his face was radiant because he had spoken with the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Aaron and all the Israelites saw Moses, his face was radiant, and they were afraid to come near him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Moses called to them; so Aaron and all the leaders of the community came back to him, and he spoke to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterwards all the Israelites came near him, and he gave them all the commands the Lord had given him on Mount Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses finished speaking to them, he put a veil over his face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But whenever he entered the Lord’s presence to speak with him, he removed the veil until he came out. And when he came out and told the Israelites what he had been commanded,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they saw that his face was radiant. Then Moses would put the veil back over his face until he went in to speak with the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses assembled the whole Israelite community and said to them, ‘These are the things the Lord has commanded you to do:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for six days, work is to be done, but the seventh day shall be your holy day, a day of sabbath rest to the Lord. Whoever does any work on it is to be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not light a fire in any of your dwellings on the Sabbath day.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said to the whole Israelite community, ‘This is what the Lord has commanded:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: from what you have, take an offering for the Lord. Everyone who is willing is to bring to the Lord an offering of gold, silver and bronze;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: blue, purple and scarlet yarn and fine linen; goat hair;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ram skins dyed red and another type of durable leather; acacia wood;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: olive oil for the light; spices for the anointing oil and for the fragrant incense;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and onyx stones and other gems to be mounted on the ephod and breastpiece.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘All who are skilled among you are to come and make everything the Lord has commanded:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the tabernacle with its tent and its covering, clasps, frames, crossbars, posts and bases;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the ark with its poles and the atonement cover and the curtain that shields it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the table with its poles and all its articles and the bread of the Presence;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the lampstand that is for light with its accessories, lamps and oil for the light;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the altar of incense with its poles, the anointing oil and the fragrant incense; the curtain for the doorway at the entrance to the tabernacle;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the altar of burnt offering with its bronze grating, its poles and all its utensils; the bronze basin with its stand;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the curtains of the courtyard with its posts and bases, and the curtain for the entrance to the courtyard;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the tent pegs for the tabernacle and for the courtyard, and their ropes;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the woven garments worn for ministering in the sanctuary – both the sacred garments for Aaron the priest and the garments for his sons when they serve as priests.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the whole Israelite community withdrew from Moses’ presence,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and everyone who was willing and whose heart moved them came and brought an offering to the Lord for the work on the tent of meeting, for all its service, and for the sacred garments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All who were willing, men and women alike, came and brought gold jewellery of all kinds: brooches, earrings, rings and ornaments. They all presented their gold as a wave offering to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who had blue, purple or scarlet yarn or fine linen, or goat hair, ram skins dyed red or other durable leather brought them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those presenting an offering of silver or bronze brought it as an offering to the Lord, and everyone who had acacia wood for any part of the work brought it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every skilled woman spun with her hands and brought what she had spun – blue, purple or scarlet yarn or fine linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the women who were willing and had the skill spun the goat hair.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The leaders brought onyx stones and other gems to be mounted on the ephod and breastpiece.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also brought spices and olive oil for the light and for the anointing oil and for the fragrant incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the Israelite men and women who were willing brought to the Lord freewill offerings for all the work the Lord through Moses had commanded them to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses said to the Israelites, ‘See, the Lord has chosen Bezalel son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he has filled him with the Spirit of God, with wisdom, with understanding, with knowledge and with all kinds of skills –
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to make artistic designs for work in gold, silver and bronze,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to cut and set stones, to work in wood and to engage in all kinds of artistic crafts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he has given both him and Oholiab son of Ahisamak, of the tribe of Dan, the ability to teach others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has filled them with skill to do all kinds of work as engravers, designers, embroiderers in blue, purple and scarlet yarn and fine linen, and weavers – all of them skilled workers and designers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Bezalel, Oholiab and every skilled person to whom the Lord has given skill and ability to know how to carry out all the work of constructing the sanctuary are to do the work just as the Lord has commanded.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses summoned Bezalel and Oholiab and every skilled person to whom the Lord had given ability and who was willing to come and do the work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They received from Moses all the offerings the Israelites had brought to carry out the work of constructing the sanctuary. And the people continued to bring freewill offerings morning after morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all the skilled workers who were doing all the work on the sanctuary left what they were doing
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to Moses, ‘The people are bringing more than enough for doing the work the Lord commanded to be done.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses gave an order and they sent this word throughout the camp: ‘No man or woman is to make anything else as an offering for the sanctuary.’ And so the people were restrained from bringing more,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because what they already had was more than enough to do all the work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All those who were skilled among the workers made the tabernacle with ten curtains of finely twisted linen and blue, purple and scarlet yarn, with cherubim woven into them by expert hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the curtains were the same size – twenty-eight cubits long and four cubits wide.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They joined five of the curtains together and did the same with the other five.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they made loops of blue material along the edge of the end curtain in one set, and the same was done with the end curtain in the other set.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also made fifty loops on one curtain and fifty loops on the end curtain of the other set, with the loops opposite each other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they made fifty gold clasps and used them to fasten the two sets of curtains together so that the tabernacle was a unit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made curtains of goat hair for the tent over the tabernacle – eleven altogether.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All eleven curtains were the same size – thirty cubits long and four cubits wide.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They joined five of the curtains into one set and the other six into another set.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they made fifty loops along the edge of the end curtain in one set and also along the edge of the end curtain in the other set.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made fifty bronze clasps to fasten the tent together as a unit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they made for the tent a covering of ram skins dyed red, and over that a covering of other durable leather.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made upright frames of acacia wood for the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each frame was ten cubits long and a cubit and a half wide,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with two projections set parallel to each other. They made all the frames of the tabernacle in this way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made twenty frames for the south side of the tabernacle
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and made forty silver bases to go under them – two bases for each frame, one under each projection.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the other side, the north side of the tabernacle, they made twenty frames
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and forty silver bases – two under each frame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made six frames for the far end, that is, the west end of the tabernacle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and two frames were made for the corners of the tabernacle at the far end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At these two corners the frames were double from the bottom all the way to the top and fitted into a single ring; both were made alike.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So there were eight frames and sixteen silver bases – two under each frame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also made crossbars of acacia wood: five for the frames on one side of the tabernacle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: five for those on the other side, and five for the frames on the west, at the far end of the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made the centre crossbar so that it extended from end to end at the middle of the frames.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They overlaid the frames with gold and made gold rings to hold the crossbars. They also overlaid the crossbars with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made the curtain of blue, purple and scarlet yarn and finely twisted linen, with cherubim woven into it by a skilled worker.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made four posts of acacia wood for it and overlaid them with gold. They made gold hooks for them and cast their four silver bases.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the entrance to the tent they made a curtain of blue, purple and scarlet yarn and finely twisted linen – the work of an embroiderer;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they made five posts with hooks for them. They overlaid the tops of the posts and their bands with gold and made their five bases of bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bezalel made the ark of acacia wood – two and a half cubits long, a cubit and a half wide, and a cubit and a half high.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He overlaid it with pure gold, both inside and out, and made a gold moulding around it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He cast four gold rings for it and fastened them to its four feet, with two rings on one side and two rings on the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he made poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he inserted the poles into the rings on the sides of the ark to carry it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made the atonement cover of pure gold – two and a half cubits long and a cubit and a half wide.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he made two cherubim out of hammered gold at the ends of the cover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made one cherub on one end and the second cherub on the other; at the two ends he made them of one piece with the cover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The cherubim had their wings spread upwards, overshadowing the cover with them. The cherubim faced each other, looking towards the cover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made the table of acacia wood – two cubits long, a cubit wide and a cubit and a half high.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they overlaid it with pure gold and made a gold moulding around it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also made around it a rim a handbreadth wide and put a gold moulding on the rim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They cast four gold rings for the table and fastened them to the four corners, where the four legs were.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rings were put close to the rim to hold the poles used in carrying the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The poles for carrying the table were made of acacia wood and were overlaid with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they made from pure gold the articles for the table – its plates and dishes and bowls and its pitchers for the pouring out of drink offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made the lampstand of pure gold. They hammered out its base and shaft, and made its flowerlike cups, buds and blossoms of one piece with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six branches extended from the sides of the lampstand – three on one side and three on the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Three cups shaped like almond flowers with buds and blossoms were on one branch, three on the next branch and the same for all six branches extending from the lampstand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the lampstand were four cups shaped like almond flowers with buds and blossoms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One bud was under the first pair of branches extending from the lampstand, a second bud under the second pair, and a third bud under the third pair – six branches in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The buds and the branches were all of one piece with the lampstand, hammered out of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made its seven lamps, as well as its wick trimmers and trays, of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made the lampstand and all its accessories from one talent of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made the altar of incense out of acacia wood. It was square, a cubit long and a cubit wide and two cubits high – its horns of one piece with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They overlaid the top and all the sides and the horns with pure gold, and made a gold moulding around it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made two gold rings below the moulding – two on each of the opposite sides – to hold the poles used to carry it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made the poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also made the sacred anointing oil and the pure, fragrant incense – the work of a perfumer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They built the altar of burnt offering of acacia wood, three cubits high; it was square, five cubits long and five cubits wide.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made a horn at each of the four corners, so that the horns and the altar were of one piece, and they overlaid the altar with bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made all its utensils of bronze – its pots, shovels, sprinkling bowls, meat forks and firepans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made a grating for the altar, a bronze network, to be under its ledge, halfway up the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They cast bronze rings to hold the poles for the four corners of the bronze grating.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made the poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They inserted the poles into the rings so they would be on the sides of the altar for carrying it. They made it hollow, out of boards.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made the bronze basin and its bronze stand from the mirrors of the women who served at the entrance to the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Next they made the courtyard. The south side was a hundred cubits long and had curtains of finely twisted linen,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with twenty posts and twenty bronze bases, and with silver hooks and bands on the posts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The north side was also a hundred cubits long and had twenty posts and twenty bronze bases, with silver hooks and bands on the posts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The west end was fifty cubits wide and had curtains, with ten posts and ten bases, with silver hooks and bands on the posts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The east end, towards the sunrise, was also fifty cubits wide.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Curtains fifteen cubits long were on one side of the entrance, with three posts and three bases,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and curtains fifteen cubits long were on the other side of the entrance to the courtyard, with three posts and three bases.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the curtains around the courtyard were of finely twisted linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The bases for the posts were bronze. The hooks and bands on the posts were silver, and their tops were overlaid with silver; so all the posts of the courtyard had silver bands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The curtain for the entrance to the courtyard was made of blue, purple and scarlet yarn and finely twisted linen – the work of an embroiderer. It was twenty cubits long and, like the curtains of the courtyard, five cubits high,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with four posts and four bronze bases. Their hooks and bands were silver, and their tops were overlaid with silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the tent pegs of the tabernacle and of the surrounding courtyard were bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the amounts of the materials used for the tabernacle, the tabernacle of the covenant law, which were recorded at Moses’ command by the Levites under the direction of Ithamar son of Aaron, the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Bezalel son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah, made everything the Lord commanded Moses;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with him was Oholiab son of Ahisamak, of the tribe of Dan – an engraver and designer, and an embroiderer in blue, purple and scarlet yarn and fine linen.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The total amount of the gold from the wave offering used for all the work on the sanctuary was 29 talents and 730 shekels, according to the sanctuary shekel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The silver obtained from those of the community who were counted in the census was 100 talents and 1,775 shekels, according to the sanctuary shekel –
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one beka per person, that is, half a shekel, according to the sanctuary shekel, from everyone who had crossed over to those counted, twenty years old or more, a total of 603,550 men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The 100 talents of silver were used to cast the bases for the sanctuary and for the curtain – 100 bases from the 100 talents, one talent for each base.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They used the 1,775 shekels to make the hooks for the posts, to overlay the tops of the posts, and to make their bands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The bronze from the wave offering was 70 talents and 2,400 shekels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They used it to make the bases for the entrance to the tent of meeting, the bronze altar with its bronze grating and all its utensils,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the bases for the surrounding courtyard and those for its entrance and all the tent pegs for the tabernacle and those for the surrounding courtyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the blue, purple and scarlet yarn they made woven garments for ministering in the sanctuary. They also made sacred garments for Aaron, as the Lord commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made the ephod of gold, and of blue, purple and scarlet yarn, and of finely twisted linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They hammered out thin sheets of gold and cut strands to be worked into the blue, purple and scarlet yarn and fine linen – the work of skilled hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made shoulder pieces for the ephod, which were attached to two of its corners, so that it could be fastened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Its skilfully woven waistband was like it – of one piece with the ephod and made with gold, and with blue, purple and scarlet yarn, and with finely twisted linen, as the Lord commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They mounted the onyx stones in gold filigree settings and engraved them like a seal with the names of the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they fastened them on the shoulder pieces of the ephod as memorial stones for the sons of Israel, as the Lord commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They fashioned the breastpiece – the work of a skilled craftsman. They made it like the ephod: of gold, and of blue, purple and scarlet yarn, and of finely twisted linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was square – a span long and a span wide – and folded double.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they mounted four rows of precious stones on it. The first row was carnelian, chrysolite and beryl;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the second row was turquoise, lapis lazuli and emerald;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the third row was jacinth, agate and amethyst;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the fourth row was topaz, onyx and jasper. They were mounted in gold filigree settings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were twelve stones, one for each of the names of the sons of Israel, each engraved like a seal with the name of one of the twelve tribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the breastpiece they made braided chains of pure gold, like a rope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made two gold filigree settings and two gold rings, and fastened the rings to two of the corners of the breastpiece.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They fastened the two gold chains to the rings at the corners of the breastpiece,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the other ends of the chains to the two settings, attaching them to the shoulder pieces of the ephod at the front.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made two gold rings and attached them to the other two corners of the breastpiece on the inside edge next to the ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they made two more gold rings and attached them to the bottom of the shoulder pieces on the front of the ephod, close to the seam just above the waistband of the ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They tied the rings of the breastpiece to the rings of the ephod with blue cord, connecting it to the waistband so that the breastpiece would not swing out from the ephod – as the Lord commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made the robe of the ephod entirely of blue cloth – the work of a weaver –
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with an opening in the centre of the robe like the opening of a collar, and a band around this opening, so that it would not tear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made pomegranates of blue, purple and scarlet yarn and finely twisted linen round the hem of the robe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they made bells of pure gold and attached them around the hem between the pomegranates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The bells and pomegranates alternated round the hem of the robe to be worn for ministering, as the Lord commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Aaron and his sons, they made tunics of fine linen – the work of a weaver –
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the turban of fine linen, the linen caps and the undergarments of finely twisted linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sash was made of finely twisted linen and blue, purple and scarlet yarn – the work of an embroiderer – as the Lord commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made the plate, the sacred emblem, out of pure gold and engraved on it, like an inscription on a seal: holy to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they fastened a blue cord to it to attach it to the turban, as the Lord commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all the work on the tabernacle, the tent of meeting, was completed. The Israelites did everything just as the Lord commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they brought the tabernacle to Moses: the tent and all its furnishings, its clasps, frames, crossbars, posts and bases;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the covering of ram skins dyed red and the covering of another durable leather and the shielding curtain;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the ark of the covenant law with its poles and the atonement cover;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the table with all its articles and the bread of the Presence;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the pure gold lampstand with its row of lamps and all its accessories, and the olive oil for the light;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the gold altar, the anointing oil, the fragrant incense, and the curtain for the entrance to the tent;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the bronze altar with its bronze grating, its poles and all its utensils; the basin with its stand;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the curtains of the courtyard with its posts and bases, and the curtain for the entrance to the courtyard; the ropes and tent pegs for the courtyard; all the furnishings for the tabernacle, the tent of meeting;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the woven garments worn for ministering in the sanctuary, both the sacred garments for Aaron the priest and the garments for his sons when serving as priests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Israelites had done all the work just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses inspected the work and saw that they had done it just as the Lord had commanded. So Moses blessed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Set up the tabernacle, the tent of meeting, on the first day of the first month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Place the ark of the covenant law in it and shield the ark with the curtain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bring in the table and set out what belongs on it. Then bring in the lampstand and set up its lamps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Place the gold altar of incense in front of the ark of the covenant law and put the curtain at the entrance to the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Place the altar of burnt offering in front of the entrance to the tabernacle, the tent of meeting;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: place the basin between the tent of meeting and the altar and put water in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Set up the courtyard around it and put the curtain at the entrance to the courtyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Take the anointing oil and anoint the tabernacle and everything in it; consecrate it and all its furnishings, and it will be holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then anoint the altar of burnt offering and all its utensils; consecrate the altar, and it will be most holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anoint the basin and its stand and consecrate them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Bring Aaron and his sons to the entrance to the tent of meeting and wash them with water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then dress Aaron in the sacred garments, anoint him and consecrate him so that he may serve me as priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bring his sons and dress them in tunics.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anoint them just as you anointed their father, so that they may serve me as priests. Their anointing will be to a priesthood that will continue throughout their generations.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses did everything just as the Lord commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the tabernacle was set up on the first day of the first month in the second year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses set up the tabernacle, he put the bases in place, erected the frames, inserted the crossbars and set up the posts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he spread the tent over the tabernacle and put the covering over the tent, as the Lord commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took the tablets of the covenant law and placed them in the ark, attached the poles to the ark and put the atonement cover over it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he brought the ark into the tabernacle and hung the shielding curtain and shielded the ark of the covenant law, as the Lord commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses placed the table in the tent of meeting on the north side of the tabernacle outside the curtain
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and set out the bread on it before the Lord, as the Lord commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He placed the lampstand in the tent of meeting opposite the table on the south side of the tabernacle
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and set up the lamps before the Lord, as the Lord commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses placed the gold altar in the tent of meeting in front of the curtain
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and burned fragrant incense on it, as the Lord commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he put up the curtain at the entrance to the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He set the altar of burnt offering near the entrance to the tabernacle, the tent of meeting, and offered on it burnt offerings and grain offerings, as the Lord commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He placed the basin between the tent of meeting and the altar and put water in it for washing,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Moses and Aaron and his sons used it to wash their hands and feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They washed whenever they entered the tent of meeting or approached the altar, as the Lord commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses set up the courtyard around the tabernacle and altar and put up the curtain at the entrance to the courtyard. And so Moses finished the work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the cloud covered the tent of meeting, and the glory of the Lord filled the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses could not enter the tent of meeting because the cloud had settled on it, and the glory of the Lord filled the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In all the travels of the Israelites, whenever the cloud lifted from above the tabernacle, they would set out;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but if the cloud did not lift, they did not set out – until the day it lifted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the cloud of the Lord was over the tabernacle by day, and fire was in the cloud by night, in the sight of all the Israelites during all their travels.
verses.speaker: Narrator
